newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Bank of America in twinning deal with Dalnevostoch.
newsitem.headline: Bank of America in twinning deal with Dalnevostoch.

text.p: Russia's Dalnevostochny Bank and Bank of America on Wednesday signed a $3 million twinning agreement, the first such deal between a U.S. and Russian bank.

The agreement, which covers two years, is part of the World Bank's Financial Institutions Development Project aimed to improve Russia's banking services and improve its access to international finance.

"Despite the fact that other banks in other regions and Moscow would be available as twinning partners, the Far Eastern region is very important for Bank of America strategically as part of our overall Pacific Rim strategy," Bank of America Vice President David Rees told a news conference.

Bank of America says some of its major clients are investing or considering investment in and trade in the Far East. A bank statement said ports in the region account for 20 percent of Russia's $20 billion trade volume.
Dalnevostochny Bank President Yadviga Dobryanskaya said that Bank of America specialists will work with Dalnevostochny to improve its documenting business and update technology.
The credit will also be used to buy and install the first automatic teller machines in the Far East in the cities of Vladivostok and Nakhodka, she said.
